newsitem.title: COLOMBIA: Police nab figure in murder of Colombian newsman.
newsitem.headline: Police nab figure in murder of Colombian newsman.

text.p: A fugitive convicted of the 1986 murder of crusading Colombian newspaperman Guillermo Cano was arrested Tuesday in Bogota, police said.

They said Luis Carlos Molina Yepes, convicted of arranging Cano's murder on behalf of late Medellin cartel drug lords Pablo Escobar and Jose Gonzalo Rodriguez Gacha, was nabbed along a highway cutting through El Chico, an upscale residential and business district of the capital.

He was sentenced in absentia in 1995 to 17 years in prison for having hired the motorcycle gunman who killed Cano. The publisher of El Espectador was killed with a burst from a MAC-10 machine-pistol outside the Bogota headquarters of his family-owned newspaper in December 1986.

Cano had crusaded for years from the respected daily's editorial pages for a crackdown on the growing influence of Colombia's drug trade and its corrosive effect on all aspects of life in the Andean nation.
He was a leading supporter of the extradition of Colombian drug lords so they could face trial and sentencing in foreign courts.
